trans-unit.source: Linking resources in Azure Resource Manager
trans-unit.target: Linking resources in Azure Resource Manager

trans-unit.source: Create a link between resources in different resource groups in Azure Resource Manager.
trans-unit.target: Create a link between resources in different resource groups in Azure Resource Manager.

trans-unit.source: Linking resources in Azure Resource Manager
trans-unit.target: Linking resources in Azure Resource Manager

trans-unit.source: Post-deployment, you may wish to query the relationships or links between resources.
trans-unit.target: Post-deployment, you may wish to query the relationships or links between resources.

trans-unit.source: Dependencies inform deployment, but that
trans-unit.target: Dependencies inform deployment, but that

trans-unit.source: lifecycle ends at deployment.
trans-unit.target: lifecycle ends at deployment.

trans-unit.source: Once deployment is complete, there is no identified relationship between dependent resources.
trans-unit.target: Once deployment is complete, there is no identified relationship between dependent resources.

trans-unit.source: Instead, Azure Resource Manager provides a new feature called resource linking to establish and query relationships
trans-unit.target: Instead, Azure Resource Manager provides a new feature called resource linking to establish and query relationships

trans-unit.source: between resources.
trans-unit.target: between resources.

trans-unit.source: You can determine which resources are linked to a resource or which resources are linked from a resource.
trans-unit.target: You can determine which resources are linked to a resource or which resources are linked from a resource.

trans-unit.source: The scope for a resource link can be a subscription, resource group or a specific resource.
trans-unit.target: The scope for a resource link can be a subscription, resource group or a specific resource.

trans-unit.source: This means that resource links can document
trans-unit.target: This means that resource links can document

trans-unit.source: relationships that span across resource groups.
trans-unit.target: relationships that span across resource groups.

trans-unit.source: As you begin to decompose your solution into multiple templates and multiple resource groups,
trans-unit.target: As you begin to decompose your solution into multiple templates and multiple resource groups,

trans-unit.source: having a mechanism to identify these resource links proves to be useful.
trans-unit.target: having a mechanism to identify these resource links proves to be useful.

trans-unit.source: For example, it is common to have a database with its own lifecycle
trans-unit.target: For example, it is common to have a database with its own lifecycle

trans-unit.source: reside in one resource group, and an app with a different lifecycle reside in a different resource group.
trans-unit.target: reside in one resource group, and an app with a different lifecycle reside in a different resource group.

trans-unit.source: The app connects to the database so
trans-unit.target: The app connects to the database so

trans-unit.source: there is a link between the resources in different resource groups.
trans-unit.target: there is a link between the resources in different resource groups.

trans-unit.source: All linked resources must belong to the same subscription.
trans-unit.target: All linked resources must belong to the same subscription.

trans-unit.source: Each resource can be linked to 50 other resources.
trans-unit.target: Each resource can be linked to 50 other resources.

trans-unit.source: If any of the linked resources are
trans-unit.target: If any of the linked resources are

trans-unit.source: deleted or moved, the link owner must clean up the remaining link.
trans-unit.target: deleted or moved, the link owner must clean up the remaining link.

trans-unit.source: Linking in templates
trans-unit.target: Linking in templates

trans-unit.source: The example below shows a template that creates a resource of type "Microsoft.AppService/apiapps"
trans-unit.target: The example below shows a template that creates a resource of type "Microsoft.AppService/apiapps"

trans-unit.source: with a set of unidirection relationships to a website, a notification hub, and SQL databases.
trans-unit.target: with a set of unidirection relationships to a website, a notification hub, and SQL databases.

trans-unit.source: Linking with REST API
trans-unit.target: Linking with REST API

trans-unit.source: To define a link between deployed resources, run:
trans-unit.target: To define a link between deployed resources, run:

trans-unit.source: Replace {subscription-id} with your subscription id.
trans-unit.target: Replace {subscription-id} with your subscription id.

trans-unit.source: Replace {resource-group}, {provider-namespace, {resource-type}, and {resource-name} with the values that
trans-unit.target: Replace {resource-group}, {provider-namespace, {resource-type}, and {resource-name} with the values that

trans-unit.source: identify the first resource in the link.
trans-unit.target: identify the first resource in the link.

trans-unit.source: Replace {link-name} with the name of the link to create.
trans-unit.target: Replace {link-name} with the name of the link to create.

trans-unit.source: Use 2015-01-01 for the api-version.
trans-unit.target: Use 2015-01-01 for the api-version.

trans-unit.source: In the request, include an object that defines the second resource in the link:
trans-unit.target: In the request, include an object that defines the second resource in the link:

trans-unit.source: The properties element contains the identifier for the second resource.
trans-unit.target: The properties element contains the identifier for the second resource.

trans-unit.source: For more examples, including how to retrieve information about links, see [Linked Resources](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/mt238499.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more examples, including how to retrieve information about links, see [Linked Resources](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/mt238499.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: You can also organize your resources with tags.
trans-unit.target: You can also organize your resources with tags.

trans-unit.source: To learn about tagging resources, see [Using tags to organize your resources](resource-group-using-tags.md).
trans-unit.target: To learn about tagging resources, see [Using tags to organize your resources](resource-group-using-tags.md).

trans-unit.source: For a description of how to create templates and define the resources to be deployed, see [Authoring templates](resource-group-authoring-templates.md).
trans-unit.target: For a description of how to create templates and define the resources to be deployed, see [Authoring templates](resource-group-authoring-templates.md).
